To build a more comprehensive and sophisticated Tradingview-like application, you can extend the example provided above in several ways. Here are some ideas:

* Use more advanced Bokeh features, such as hover tools and legends, to enhance the interactivity and usability of the visualizations.
* Add more chart types, such as candlestick charts, to support different types of data and analysis.
* Use database queries to filter and aggregate the data, and to support different time frames and scales in the visualizations.
* Implement authentication and authorization to restrict access to certain data or features, and to support multiple users and user profiles.
* Use JavaScript and other web technologies, such as WebSockets, to implement real-time updates and push notifications for new data.
* Use machine learning algorithms, such as time series forecasting, to provide predictions and insights based on the data.

Building a Tradingview-like application is a complex and challenging task, but it is also a rewarding and exciting project that can provide powerful tools for data analysis and visualization. With the right combination of Python libraries and frameworks, and a strong focus on usability and performance, you can create a world-class web application for real-time data analysis and visualization.
